summary:
HTTP, or Hypertext Transfer Protocol, is the way computers talk to each other on the internet. It lets us browse the World Wide Web by clicking on links. Tim Berners-Lee started developing HTTP in 1989. Over time, it has improved, with versions like HTTP/1.1 and HTTP/2 making websites faster. 

The secure version, HTTPS, is used on most websites. The newest version, HTTP/3, is even faster and is being adopted by many websites and web browsers.
title: HTTP
